backend/main.mo: Empty Motoko actor serving as the backend canister entry point.
feature_evidence.json: Feature evidence report documenting premium visual styling, typography upgrades, hero section enhancements, and other UI improvements with associated files, components, and test IDs.
frontend-file-summaries.txt: JSON-formatted summaries of frontend files describing premium UI components, pages with glassmorphism effects, animations, and mobile enhancements.
frontend/index.css: Tailwind base styles with CSS custom properties defining OKLCH color system for light and dark themes.
frontend/index.html: HTML entry point with root div and module script loading main.tsx for the Oishi Heal Touch healthcare website.
frontend/src/App.tsx: TanStack Router configuration defining routes for all pages (home, doctors, about, lab tests, why us, testimonials, contact, blog) wrapped in Layout component.
frontend/src/components/Layout.tsx: Shared layout component with glassmorphism header, gradient logo, rounded pill navigation, mobile sheet menu, sticky CTA button, and footer with dynamic year.
frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts: React Query hook managing backend actor creation with Internet Identity authentication, handling anonymous and authenticated states with automatic query invalidation.
frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.t: React context and hook for Internet Identity authentication providing login, logout, identity state management, and AuthClient configuration with delegation handling.
frontend/src/index.css: Global CSS file that imports Tailwind directives and defines CSS custom properties for light/dark themes using OKLCH color space, plus utility classes for glassmorphism effects, premium buttons, and card animations.
frontend/src/main.tsx: Application entry point that sets up React root with QueryClient and InternetIdentityProvider wrappers, then renders the App component.
frontend/src/pages/AboutPage.tsx: About page component for Oishi Heal Touch healthcare facility that displays introduction, story, mission, and vision sections with scroll-reveal animations using IntersectionObserver.
frontend/src/pages/BlogPage.tsx: Blog listing page with search functionality and category filters, displaying healthcare-related blog posts with titles, excerpts, dates, and categories using scroll-reveal animations.
frontend/src/pages/ContactPage.tsx: Contact page with a form that submits to WhatsApp and displays clinic contact information including phone, address, and operating hours in card layouts.
frontend/src/pages/DoctorsPage.tsx: Doctors listing page displaying a grid of doctor cards with name, specialty, schedule, and fees information, featuring specialty-based color-coded badges and scroll-reveal animations.
frontend/src/pages/HomePage.tsx: Main landing page component displaying hero section, clinic/lab services, highlights, testimonials, and call-to-action sections with scroll animations and intersection observers.
frontend/src/pages/LabTestsPage.tsx: Lab tests and diagnostics page showcasing Pathkind Lab partnership, test categories (full body checkup, diabetes, cardiac, thyroid, women's health), and booking options with scroll reveal animations.
frontend/src/pages/TestimonialsPage.tsx: Testimonials page displaying 15 patient reviews with 5-star ratings for various doctors and services, using card components and scroll-triggered animations.
frontend/src/pages/WhyUsPage.tsx: Why Choose Us page highlighting seven key differentiators including Pathkind partnership, experienced doctors, specialist coverage, advanced therapies, affordable pricing, easy booking, and hygiene standards.
frontend/tailwind.config.js: Tailwind CSS configuration defining custom theme extensions including OKLCH color system, typography, container queries, custom shadows (soft, premium, glow), border radius scales, and animation utilities.
project_state.json: Project state file for Oishi Heal Touch healthcare clinic website redesign in Kolkata. Defines premium visual UI/UX enhancement requirements including glassmorphism, gradient overlays, typography upgrades, hero section enhancements, service card improvements, and mobile-first responsive design while maintaining existing layout and brand colors.
